bug.author: dragon28
bug.description:
Hello Developers, I am having issue with ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ray.rllib.agents.maddpg' when import ray.rllib.agents.maddpg.maddpg as maddpg. I happened when I tried to run the at cloned the following git repository <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wsjeon/maddpg-rllib>https://github.com/wsjeon/maddpg-rllib</denchmark-link>
OS: Ubuntu 18.04 64-bits <denchmark-code>uname -a Linux WorkStation 5.0.0-37-generic #40~18.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Thu Nov 14 12:06:39 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux </denchmark-code>
Python version: <denchmark-code>python3 --version Python 3.6.9 </denchmark-code>
Tensorflow version: 1.14.0 (CPU) Pytorch version: 1.2.0+cpu <denchmark-code>pip3 list Package Version Location ----------------------------- ------------------- comments.comment: I noticed this as well. Looks like maddpg is actually in ray.rllib.contrib.maddpg. So import that and it should work.
I made a PR for this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wsjeon/maddpg-rllib/pull/7>wsjeon/maddpg-rllib#7</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sanjeevanahilan>@sanjeevanahilan</denchmark-link> thank you for pointing it out. üëç
